intro: Anemone chrysopetala, commonly known as the golden petal anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, yellow flowers with petal-like structures that are arranged in a star-shaped pattern, giving it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has basal leaves that are palmately lobed. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Anemone chrysopetala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
